text:

title: Isselmou Oumar
text:
I’m a Quantitative Analyst at Societe Generale in Paris, working on climate risk modeling within the RISQ/MDL/MOD team. I graduated with a Financial Engineering degree from ENSIMAG and a Msc in Quantitative Finance from IAE Grenoble, specializing in stochastic calculus, advanced quantitative techniques and statistical analysis.
Outside of work, I enjoy exploring new technologies and problem-solving. I’m also passionate about sharing knowledge and contributing to the finance and tech communities.
Interests: Algorithmic Trading, Quantitative Finance, Climate Risk Modeling and Continuous Learning



If you have questions about my work or are interested in collaborating, feel free to contact me. I am always interested in discussing workshop offerings and collaborative opportunities.

American Option Pricing
Code: GitHub Repository
A C++ implementation of Longstaff-Schwartz for American option pricing.
Key Features:

Uses multidimensional Black-Scholes framework.
Reads input from JSON files.
